intro: Prepodesma orpenii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Prepodesma orpenii has cultural significance to the Māori people and is used in traditional crafts and medicine.
